items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Meeting Called to Order at Evergreen Valley College, 3095 Yerba Buena Road, San Jose, CA 95135, in Gullo II Building
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Meeting Called to Order at Evergreen Valley College, 3095 Yerba Buena Road, San Jose, CA 95135, in Gullo II Building

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
This is an opportunity for members of the public to address the Board concerning issues not listed on the agenda.
	 
The Board welcomes this opportunity to hear from the public and has established a policy for the public's participation in board meetings, which is outlined in BP 2345. This policy states that:
	 
No member of the public may speak without being recognized by the President of the Board.
Each speaker will be allowed a maximum of three minutes per topic. Thirty minutes shall be the maximum time allotment for public speakers on any one subject regardless of the number of speakers at any one Board meeting. At the discretion of a majority of the Board, these time limits may be extended.
The Board recognizes the need to encourage public participation but also recognizes the need to preserve order and the proper functioning of the meeting. Citizens addressing the Board at meetings shall therefore conduct themselves at all times in a manner appropriate to the setting.

items.item_details:
1. Position Management
	 
a. Classification Elimination
Telecommunications System Technician
	 
b. Position Elimination
Telecommunications System Technician, 100% FTE, (9TELE0201C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office effective 06/30/15.
	 
c. Classification Establishment
Information Technology Technician –  See attached job description.
	 
d. Position Establishment
Program Coordinator, 100% FTE, (9IBCD0270C) at the Workforce Institute Department at the District Office effective 10/28/15.
	 
Information Technology Technician, 100% FTE, (9ITSS0234C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office effective 07/01/15.
	 
2. Change of Status
	 
a.  Reclassification
Reclassification process per the CSEA CBA Chapter 363 Article 23.1” and Article 23.3 “Reclassification will become effective July 1 of the year following the reclassification request.”
	 
b. Promotion
The employee is promoted to College Fiscal Coordinator, 100% FTE, (7BUSS0209C) in the Administrative Services Department at San Jose City College from Senior Division Administrative Assistant, 100% FTE, (7SSHU0205C) in the Social Sciences & Humanities Department at San Jose City College effective 10/12/15.
	 
3. Separation
Employee separation effective 02/15/16.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
The curriculum proposals have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC) acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that each new recommendation has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear need not being served by existing curriculum.
	 
ECE 149: Inclusion of Children with Special Needs in Early Childhood Education
ECE 150: Practicum Experience in an Inclusive Classroom
JOURN 150: Introduction to Public Relations
THEAT 050: Introduction to Theatre Design

items.item_details:
California Code of Regulations Section 58305(d) requires districts to prepare an Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor's Office.  The report is the vehicle for summarizing and communicating the results of budgetary decisions and transactions of all governmental, proprietary, and fiduciary funds for the fiscal year.  The information is then compiled system-wide by the State Chancellor's Office.
	 
The attached Fiscal Year 2014-2015 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) is presented to the Board of Trustees as an information item.

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
	 
The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
	 
1.To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
	 
2.To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
